summary: I'M GOING TO LIST EVERY SAFETY DEFECT WITH MY 1996 GMC SIERRA SINCE I PURCHASED IT USED IN 2008. WHEN I FIRST BOUGHT IT I HEARD A SWISHING SOUND IN THE HEATER CORE AND THE AIRBAG LIGHT WAS ILLUMINATED IN THE INSTRUMENT PANEL, BUT I THOUGHT IT WAS JUST LOW ON ANTI FREEZE AND THAT MY REPAIR FACILITY COULD FIX THE AIR BAG; BUT AS IT TURNS OUT THE CLOCK SPRING IN THE STEERING WHEEL WAS BAD AND I COULDN'T AFFORD TO GET THE AIR BAG FIXED. THE SWISHING SOUND WAS CAUSED BY AIR IN THE COOLING SYSTEM DUE TO A LEAKING INTAKE MANIFOLD GASKET; IT HAD TO BE REPLACED FOR 600.00 $. A BRAKE LINE RUSTED OUT (YES I KNOW IT'S AN OLD TRUCK), THE FUEL LINES ARE RUSTING AND WILL HAVE TO BE REPLACED SOON, AND THE OIL COOLER LINES ARE LEAKING BECAUSE GM VEHICLES HAVE FLUID LINES THAT ARE PRONE TO FAILURE.       THE WIND SHIELD WIPERS DON'T ALWAYS TURN ON WHEN IT'S RAINING BECAUSE OF CRACKED SOLDER JOINTS IN THE CONTROL MODULE AND I REPLACED A HEATER/FAN MOTOR. I PULLED MY ABS FUSE AND DISABLED THE SYSTEM BECAUSE MY ABS WAS ACTIVATING ON DRY PAVEMENT AT LOW SPEEDS AND CAUSING AN INCREASED STOPPING DISTANCE; A REAL DANGER IN PARKING LOTS WHERE A CHILD COULD RUN OUT IN FRONT OF MY TRUCK. I DON'T HAVE A GRAND TO REPLACE RUSTED HUBS AND SENSORS TO MAKE MY ABS WORK AGAIN.      THE DRIVERS SIDE CAST METAL DOOR HANDLE BROKE AND I REPLACED IT MYSELF WITH A DEALER PART FOR 80.00$ ONE WOULD HATE TO BE IN A WRECK AND HAVE THE HANDLE FAIL WHEN THAT DOOR IS THE ONLY EXIT IN AN EMERGENCY!    I'M ON MY THIRD FUEL PUMP AND FORTH FUEL PUMP SENDING UNIT WHICH IS THE REASON WHY I'M WRITING THIS COMPLAINT. MY TRUCK COULD STALL OUT IN TRAFFIC AT ANY TIME AND I NO LONGER FEEL SAFE OR CONFIDENT DRIVING IT; I FEEL IT'S A BAD DESIGN AND A SAFETY ISSUE. THE PUMP AND SENDING UNIT ARE IN THE FUEL TANK, WHICH IN AN INCONVENIENT LOCATION AT BEST. I CAN'T SPARE 500.00 OR 600.00 EVERY YEAR OR SO TO HAVE NEW COMPONENTS INSTALLED IN MY GAS TANK, IF YOU WANT TO BUY AN OLD GM OR CHEVY TRUCK'..YOU'VE BEEN FOREWARNED!   *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1996 GMC SIERRA 1500 WITH COOPER DISCOVERY H/T P325 75/R15 TIRES. THE DOT NUMBER FOR THE FRONT TIRES WAS 3DHL AND THE REAR PASSENGER TIRE WAS UTHL. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THREE OF THE FOUR COOPER TIRES ON THE VEHICLE HAVE EXPERIENCED TREAD SEPARATION. THE TWO FRONT TIRES AND THE REAR PASSENGER TIRE HAD ALSO FAILED. THE CONTACT PURCHASED THE FRONT TIRES THREE YEARS AGO AND THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE TIRE FIVE YEARS AGO. THE TIRE MECHANIC CONFIRMED THAT THE TIRES WERE DEFECTIVE. THE FRONT TIRES HAD 20000 MILES AND THE REAR PASSENGER TIRE HAD 30000 MILES. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE WHEN THE COMPLAINT WAS FILED.

AS I WAS ENTERING FLORIDA I HAD JUST PASED SEVERAL CARS AND TRUCKS AT ABOUT 7 PM SUNDAY NIGHT .   I WAS RELAXING AND PULLED MY LEFT FOOT BACK TO THE SEAT WHEN I BUMPED THE HOOD RELEASE WITH MY FOOT.  THE HOOD IMEDIATLY OPENED ALL THE WAY BACK TO THE WIND SHIELD.  I IMMEDIATEL STARTED WATCHING THE ROAD BESIDE THE TRUCK, PUT ON MY TURN SIGNAL .  THE MAN BEHIND ME SAW WHAT HAD HAPPENED AND FLASHED HIS LIGHTS AT ME AND SLOWED DOWN THE TRAFIC BEHINDE ME SO I COULD SAFELY PULL OFF THE ROAD.   LUCKILY WE WERE NOT HURT AND THE WINDSHIELD DID NOT GET BROKEN.  I HAD A STRAP WITH ME THAT I USED TO HOLD DOWN THE HOOD SO WE WERE ABLE TO PROSEED TO OUR DESTINATION.  I CALLED THE LOCAL GMC DEALER TO SEE IF THERE WAS A RECALL ON HOOD LATCH, AND THEY SAID THERE WAS NOT.  I WENT TO THE DEALERSHIP TO GET AN ESTIMATE.  I THEN WENT TO THE CHEVY DEALER TO CHECK ON A NEW TRUCK, AND FOUND THAT IN 2000 THEY CHANGED THE HOOD LATCH TO A STILE THAT COULD NOT COME ALL THE WAY OPEN THE WAY MINE DID.  THE RELEASE LEVER IS STILL IN THE SAME PLACE AND CAN BE COUGHT BY YOUR FOOT AND CAUSE THE HOOD TO UNLATCH, BUT WITH THE NEW SAFETY THAT IS PART OF THE HOOD LATCH IT CAN NOT OPEN ALL THE WAY.  I CAN NOT BELEAVE THAT THERE HAS BEEN NOONE ELSE THAT HAS HAD THIS HAPPEN TO THEM AND THAT THEY WOULD HAVE CHANGED THE LATCH IN 2000 UNLESS THEY HAD PROBLEMS.  I DID NOT TRUST THE TRUCK ANYMORE  THINKING OF HOW EASILY WE COULD HAVE BEEN KILLED IF THE CONDITIONS HAD BEEN DIFERENT, SO I TRADED IT IN ON A 97 FORD F150 BEFORE I LEFT.  I HAD CALLED THE GMC HOTLINE AND REPORTED THIS TO THEM. THEY SAID THAT THEY WOULD PUT IT IN MY RECORDS.  I HAVE CONTACTED AN ATTURNEY WHO SAID IF I CAN FIND IF MORE PEOPLE HAVE HAD THIS PROBLEM THAT HE WOULD CONSIDER A CLASS ACTION SUTE AGINST GMC FOR THIS PROBLEM.  IT COULD HAVE BEEN ELIMINATED BY SIMPLY PUTTING A SHIELD OVER THE INSIDE RELEASE SO YOUR FOOT COULD NOT CATCH IT.   WHEN I RETURNED TO MICHIGAN I WAS TALKING TO A FRIEND WHO SAID THAT HE'S POPING THE HOOD ON HIS CHEVROLET
